title.narrative: 1.2. QUALITY & INCLUSIVE EDUCATION

description.narrative: 1.2. Strengthened national capacity to plan, provide and monitor access to quality and inclusive education, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 1. Education - Improved access to learning opportunities

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.2. Strengthened national capacity to plan, provide and monitor access to quality and inclusive education

description.narrative: In close partnership with MOEHE and partners,UNICEF continued to lead life-skills education in Palestine and strengthens school emergency preparedness; supports implementation of non-violence in school policy; and provides humanitarian assistance in the West Bank and Gaza. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Number and percentage of schools with mechanisms to prevent violence in schools and protect children
Number of schools using established SMIS system

actual.value: 2017:Fully Achieved: SMIS rolled out in 100 government schools

title.narrative: Number of teachers that are applying teaching and learning methods in line with CFS standards, including inclusive education

actual.value: 2017:Fully Achieved: 8,238 teachers trained, three teacher active learning manuals for Arabic, Math and Science developed by nine head teachers and supervisors. (including 1,278 in 2017)

title.narrative: Primary teachers who received training with funding provided by UNICEF
e2a. EMIS that provides quality and timely data - score (1-4), see guidance

actual.value: 2016:3 Implementation in 100 select schools starting in August 2016

title.narrative: Number of children and teachers in the most vulnerable areas accompanied by protective presence partners to and from schools at least twice a week

actual.value: 2017:Fully Achieved: 8,123 (total) children (4,821 male + 3,302 female) and 414 teachers (162 male + 252 female), including additional 3,456 children in 2017 not covered before.
